workflow.name: Automate actuarial premium adjustments and claims reporting with GPT-4.1, Gmail and Slack
workflow.description:
## How It Works
This workflow automates insurance claims processing by deploying specialized AI agents to analyze actuarial data, draft claim memos, and perform risk assessments. Designed for insurance adjusters, underwriters, and claims managers handling high claim volumes, it solves the bottleneck of manual claim review that delays settlements and increases operational costs. The system ingests new claims data via scheduled triggers, then routes information to an actuarial analysis agent that calculates loss ratios and risk scores. A memo writer agent generates detailed claim summaries with recommendations, while a risk assessment agent evaluates fraud indicators and coverage implications. An orchestrator agent coordinates these specialists, ensuring consistent analysis standards. Final reports are automatically distributed via email to product teams and Slack notifications to risk management, creating transparent workflows while reducing claim processing time from days to hours with standardized, comprehensive evaluations.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure claims database API credentials in "Fetch New Claims Data" node
2. Input NVIDIA API key for all OpenAI Model nodes  
3. Add OpenAI API key in Orchestrator Agent configuration
4. Set up Calculator Tool parameters for premium adjustment calculations
5. Configure Gmail credentials and recipient addresses for product team  
6. Connect Slack workspace and specify risk team channel for alerts
 
## Prerequisites
NVIDIA API access, OpenAI API key, claims management system API
## Use Cases
Auto insurance claim triage, property damage assessment automation
## Customization
Adjust risk scoring thresholds, add industry-specific analysis criteria
## Benefits
Reduces claim processing time by 85%, ensures consistent evaluation standards

workflow.name: Real-time actuarial premium adjustment and reporting system

parameters.text: =Analyze the following claims data and recalculate actuarial assumptions: {{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert actuarial analyst specializing in insurance claims analysis.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze the provided claims data for patterns and trends
2. Recalculate key actuarial assumptions including:
   - Loss ratios
   - Claim frequency rates
   - Average claim severity
   - Reserve adequacy
3. Use the Calculator tool for all mathematical computations
4. Return your analysis in the structured JSON format defined by the output parser

Be thorough and precise in your calculations.

You are a professional actuarial memo writer.

Your task is to:
1. Create a comprehensive actuarial memo documenting the premium adjustment analysis
2. Include executive summary, methodology, findings, and recommendations
3. Use professional actuarial terminology and formatting
4. Return the memo in structured JSON format with sections

Ensure the memo is clear, concise, and suitable for executive review.

parameters.toolDescription: Generates professional actuarial memos documenting premium adjustments and analysis

options.systemMessage:
You are a risk management specialist for insurance products.

Your task is to:
1. Evaluate the risk implications of the proposed premium adjustments
2. Assess potential impacts on:
   - Portfolio profitability
   - Market competitiveness
   - Regulatory compliance
   - Customer retention
3. Provide risk mitigation strategies
4. Return your assessment in structured JSON format

Be thorough in identifying both upside and downside risks.

parameters.toolDescription: Evaluates risk implications of premium adjustments and provides risk management recommendations

parameters.text: =Coordinate the generation of actuarial memo and risk assessment for the following premium adjustment data: {{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

options.systemMessage:
You are an orchestrator coordinating actuarial reporting and risk assessment tasks.

Your task is to:
1. Call the Memo Writer tool to generate a comprehensive actuarial memo
2. Call the Risk Assessor tool to evaluate risk implications
3. Combine both outputs into a final report
4. Return the complete report in structured JSON format

Ensure both tools receive the necessary context from the premium adjustment data.

parameters.message:
=

Premium Adjustment Report

Report Date: {{ $json.reportDate }}

Premium Adjustment: {{ $json.premiumAdjustment }}%

Actuarial Memo

Title: {{ $json.actuarialMemo.title }}

Executive Summary: {{ $json.actuarialMemo.executiveSummary }}

Findings: {{ $json.actuarialMemo.findings }}

Risk Assessment

Overall Risk Level: {{ $json.riskAssessment.overallRiskLevel }}

Profitability Impact: {{ $json.riskAssessment.profitabilityImpact }}

Action Items

    {{ $json.actionItems.map(item => `
  • ${item}
    • `).join("") }}

Please review and provide approval if required.
parameters.subject: =Actuarial Update: Premium Adjustment Report - {{ $json.reportDate }}

nodes.name: Send Slack Message to Risk Team

parameters.content:
## Prerequisites
NVIDIA API access, OpenAI API key, claims management system API
## Use Cases
Auto insurance claim triage, property damage assessment automation
## Customization
Adjust risk scoring thresholds, add industry-specific analysis criteria
## Benefits
Reduces claim processing time by 85%, ensures consistent evaluation standards

## Setup Steps
1. Configure claims database API credentials in "Fetch New Claims Data" node
2. Input NVIDIA API key for all OpenAI Model nodes  
3. Add OpenAI API key in Orchestrator Agent configuration
4. Set up Calculator Tool parameters for premium adjustment calculations
5. Configure Gmail credentials and recipient addresses for product team  
6. Connect Slack workspace and specify risk team channel for alerts

## How It Works
This workflow automates insurance claims processing by deploying specialized AI agents to analyze actuarial data, draft claim memos, and perform risk assessments. Designed for insurance adjusters, underwriters, and claims managers handling high claim volumes, it solves the bottleneck of manual claim review that delays settlements and increases operational costs. The system ingests new claims data via scheduled triggers, then routes information to an actuarial analysis agent that calculates loss ratios and risk scores. A memo writer agent generates detailed claim summaries with recommendations, while a risk assessment agent evaluates fraud indicators and coverage implications. An orchestrator agent coordinates these specialists, ensuring consistent analysis standards. Final reports are automatically distributed via email to product teams and Slack notifications to risk management, creating transparent workflows while reducing claim processing time from days to hours with standardized, comprehensive evaluations.

## Actuarial Analysis Execution
**Why:** Statistical modeling identifies patterns and calculates risk metrics that inform pricing accuracy and reserve adequacy beyond human capacity at scale.

## Scheduled Claims Data Ingestion
**Why:** Automated retrieval ensures timely processing of new claims without manual data entry, maintaining consistent workflow cadence and preventing backlogs.

## Claim Memo Generation
**Why:** Standardized documentation ensures regulatory compliance and consistent decision-making while eliminating time-consuming manual report writing.

## Multi-Dimensional Risk Assessment & Email
**Why:** Parallel evaluation of fraud indicators, policy compliance, and financial exposure provides comprehensive risk profiles for informed adjudication.

main.node: Send Slack Message to Risk Team

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.
